data.current_summary: The OAuth2 authorization endpoint. Your app redirects a user to this endpoint, allowing them to delegate access to their account.
data.current_description:
Security Advice

* Using the [implicit OAuth authorization flow](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-security-topics-16#section-2.1.2) (`response_type=token`) is **not recommended**. It can suffer from access token leakage and access token replay attacks. Use `response_type=code` instead. * Use the `state` parameter for [CSRF protection](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-security-topics-16#section-4.7). Pass a sufficient random nonce here and verify this nonce again after retrieving the token.
data.description_suggestion: Initiates the OAuth2 authorization flow by redirecting the user to SoundCloud's authorization endpoint. The user grants permission for your application to access their account. Returns an authorization code (when using response_type=code) or access token (when using response_type=token) via redirect to the specified redirect_uri. Security best practices: Use response_type=code instead of implicit flow to prevent token leakage. Include a state parameter for CSRF protection and verify it after token retrieval.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too long and reads more like a description. Description lacks clarity on what is returned and how the redirect works. Added concise summary, clarified the authorization flow mechanics, specified return values (authorization code or token), and integrated security advice into the operational context for better AI agent understanding.
